{"script": "Alright, let's dive into what's happening around the world today. Honestly, we've got some wild stories coming at you, so get ready!

First up, we've got the tea on why Trump attacked that judge and his family during a speech at Mar-a-Lago. Apparently, according to CNN's Maggie Haberman, the reasoning behind his outburst was...well, let's just say it's classic Trump. Gotta love the plot twists with that guy, am I right?

Moving on to international news - NATO's boss just straight-up mocked the Russian navy, saying they're out here hunting for the Red October, but can't even find the nearest mechanic to fix their sub. Wild stuff, honestly. Apparently, this Russian sub surfaced off the coast of Western Europe, and no one's quite sure if it's damaged or what. Lowkey hoping they call in the Ghostbusters on this one.

Now for some business and tech updates - EVs are taking a backseat in Stellantis' $13 billion investment plan for the US. Instead, they're focusing on developing five new vehicles and a four-cylinder engine.
